summaries.body: An in-office recycling machine made by Epson promises to turn waste paper into new paper in three minutes. Its price and energy consumption haven't been revealed.
Tickets for Adele's 2016 European tour sold out within minutes on Friday, prompting the singer to add several extra shows. Those tickets go on sale Monday.

display_asset.caption: For fans awaiting the release of “Star Wars: The Force Awakens,” here are a few apps that feature popular Star Wars games.
display_asset.credit: Produced by By KIT EATON and DALLAS JENSEN
display_asset.title: App Smart | Star Wars Fever

summaries.body: For fans awaiting the release of “Star Wars: The Force Awakens,” here are a few apps that feature popular Star Wars games.
Avon is said to be in discussions to sell its North American business to a private equity firm as part of an effort to turn around the cosmetics maker's fortunes.
Two men in central China were sentenced to at least 10 years in prison for selling Eurasian hobbies, a protected species of falcon.

display_asset.caption: Camille Cosby, who has been married to Bill Cosby since 1964.

summaries.body: Lawyers for seven women suing Bill Cosby for defamation in Massachusetts federal court have served notice that they hope to question Mr. Cosby's wife, Camille, in January.

display_asset.credit: Kevin Mazur/AEG, via Agence France-Presse -- Getty Images

summaries.body: Michael Jackson's estate is being sued by a producer who says he's been denied access to music and other items to make a tribute film despite a contract his son had with the singer.

display_asset.caption: Members of the Secret Service disembarked their helicopter ahead of President Obama, who was about to board Air Force One at Andrews Air Force Base in October last year.

summaries.body: The Secret Service is understaffed, according to a bipartisan House report that said budget-related hiring freezes had left fewer agents protecting the White House.

display_asset.caption: Coldplay will perform with other, as-yet-unnamed acts at the Super Bowl on Feb. 7.

summaries.body: Coldplay will perform in the Super Bowl halftime show, the N.F.L. announced Thursday night during a game between Detroit and Green Bay.

display_asset.caption: Former President George W. Bush and Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. spoke at a presentation of a bust of former Vice President Dick Cheney in the Capitol.
display_asset.credit: Produced by By THE ASSOCIATED PRESS
display_asset.title: Cheney’s Bust

summaries.body: A bust of former Vice President Dick Cheney was unveiled in the Capitol, and George W. Bush and Joseph R. Biden Jr. were among those who spoke at the presentation.
Republicans in New Jersey declined to override Gov. Chris Christie’s veto of a gun-control bill that they had unanimously supported in June.
A nearly 14,000-year-old engraving on a stone found in Spain may be the earliest depiction of a campsite.
Amid large and occasionally violent protests in the streets, Ecuador's National Assembly passed a constitutional amendment to lift presidential term limits.
NASA cargo rocket to space station launch today scrubbed b/c of bad weather. May try tomorrow, but weather still not great.
The pop star Taylor Swift, who is a fan of the Seattle Symphony’s recording of “Become Ocean,” by John Luther Adams, has given $50,000 to the orchestra.

display_asset.caption: Ben Carson at the lectern before the Republican Jewish Coalition on Thursday in Washington.

summaries.body: Ben Carson failed to impress the Republican Jewish Coalition when he mispronounced the name of the extremist group Hamas, saying something that sounded more like hummus.

display_asset.caption: Flood-ravaged Chennai, India, on Thursday after heavy rains.
display_asset.credit: Atul Yadav/Press Trust of India, via Associated Press

summaries.body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi of India traveled to the southern city of Chennai to assess torrential flooding that has killed at least 269 people in the surrounding area.
An unlicensed doctor in Cambodia has been found guilty of spreading H.I.V. with reused syringes to over 100 people, killing at least 10. He is now facing 25 years in prison.

display_asset.caption: Protesters blocked vehicles headed for the telescope’s groundbreaking ceremony on Mauna Kea, on the Big Island of Hawaii, in October 2014.

summaries.body: The State Supreme Court in Hawaii has rescinded the construction permit for the Thirty Meter Telescope, an observatory planned for the state's tallest mountain.
Researchers said they had developed a technique for creating a substance they are calling Q-carbon, a new form of carbon that is harder than diamond.

display_asset.caption: Lori Berenson at her residence in Lima, Peru, last week. Her 20-year sentence for aiding leftist rebels ended Sunday.

summaries.body: Lori Berenson, 46, who served a 20-year sentence in Peru for aiding leftist rebels, was preparing to return home to the United States on Wednesday.
Linda Ellerbee, the longtime host of news programs for children on Nickelodeon, is retiring from journalism after 44 years. Her last show will air on Dec. 15.
The Michigan Senate voted to repeal over 80 antiquated laws, including a 90-day sentence for trespassing on a cranberry, huckleberry or blackberry marsh.
Citing rising rent costs, Toys “R” Us will close its flagship store in Times Square at the end of December, cutting almost 400 jobs.

display_asset.caption: Brazil's president, Dilma Rousseff, spoke at a news conference in Brasilia on Wednesday.

summaries.body: Brazil’s lower house agreed to start impeachment proceedings against President Dilma Rousseff, who is grappling with an economic downturn and a graft scandal.
Harvard plans to rename its heads of residential housing from “house masters” to a term that better reflects “21st-century needs,” the college dean, Rakesh Khurana, said.

display_asset.caption: Mayor Rahm Emanuel of Chicago at a news conference on Tuesday.
display_asset.credit: Ashlee Rezin/Sun-Times Media, via Associated Press

summaries.body: One day after firing his police commissioner, Mayor Rahm Emanuel of Chicago said he would not resign over a police shooting that was exposed on video.

display_asset.caption: A scene from “Les Misérables” at the Imperial Theater.

summaries.body: The current revival of Broadway’s "Les Misérables" will close in September after more than 1,000 performances.

display_asset.caption: Glen Doherty in an undated photograph. He was one of four Americans killed in the Sept. 11, 2012, attack in Benghazi, Libya.
display_asset.credit: Quigley Family Photo, via Associated Press

summaries.body: The family of Glen Doherty, one of four Americans killed in the 2012 attacks in Libya, is still waiting for the C.I.A. to fulfill an agreement to pay his death benefits.
The city of Chennai, India, has been declared a disaster zone because of deadly flooding from relentless rain.
